meanings.definition: Used to express disbelief or rejection.
meanings.sent3: When he said he could fly, I just said 'phooey' and laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like a pile of phooey, easily seen through.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a talking dog seemed like pure phooey to me.

meanings.sent1: She dismissed his explanation as phooey.
meanings.sent2: The whole story was just a bunch of phooey.
meanings.sent3: The cat's plan to take over the world was complete phooey.
meanings.sent4: His promises were nothing but phooey, like a broken record.
meanings.sent5: The so-called magic potion turned out to be pure phooey.
